page.title: 10SHOPPING IN LYDBROOK
page.content: Lydbrook has a post office,a supermarket,a general stores,two butchers,a woolshop,a stripped pine furniture specialist,a second hand furniture shop and a hairdressers.Lydbrook recently lost its chemist shop.Several mobile vans boost the shopping facilities.This provision does not cover all needs. Shopping habits are changing and less is done locally. The majority of families do one large weekly or fortnightly shop in the nearest town. Weekly markets are now held at Cinderford and Coleford for which free transport is provided.The local bus company provides a bus on Friday evenings to Lydney where Kwiksave is a popular supermarket.In August another branch opened in Coleford so the Lydney bus may be discontinued.
